metadata.Title: CVE-2019-16718 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: In radare2 before 3.9.0, a command injection vulnerability exists inbin_symbols() in libr/core/cbin.c. By using a crafted executable file, it'spossible to execute arbitrary shell commands with the permissions of thevictim. This vulnerability is due to an insufficient fix for CVE-2019-14745and improper handling of symbol names embedded in executables.

criterions.comment: radare2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
